Posts.Content: Tumor marker tests really only tell the MD that you need to watched. They are not reliable and are known to have spikes due to many reasons unrelated to cancer.  I send you a gentle hug.
Posts.Title: tumoro markers

Posts.Content: I am so very , very sorry that you mom when through this personal hell. It is once again proof that we have to be our own health care advocates. We have to ask questions & question the answers. I ( we) wish you and your mom the best that can be.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer misdiagnosis Nightmare

Posts.Content: On Jan 18, 2015 4:16 AM ohiolady wrote: Hi,      I was wondering about why my hair was coming back so little.  I too am pretty depressed about this.  I know we are supposed to be happy to be alive but sometimes you just want to get back to the way you were so I understand. Hope u are doing better. I call it the "beautifully brave" syndrome. I have been sliced, diced , fried and filled with chemicals. I think its ok to be a little unhappy about it. I hear often that it is important to stay positive. That is a bunch of malarkey. It has been proven that the suppression of feelings causes stress which in turn causes all kinds health issues.  So if you miss  how your hair was, just say so. Missing what you lost does not mean you are ungrateful for your life. It means you had to endure a great deal of changes for the sake of life and those changes are difficult. I cry alone for a few minutes everyday. Then I force myself to shake it off and move on but I AM going to cry. I have good reason, so much is changed and I miss the old me. I wish you the best.
Posts.Title: 2 years after chemo, my hair has not grown back

Posts.Content: I feel for you sister. Waiting is really hard. Uncertainly is even harder and the unknown is terrifying.  Calcifications are sometimes just that...calcifications and not cancer. But they dont know for certain unless there is a biopsy. When(if) the biopsy comes back clear for cancer you will probably have another mammogram is 6 months to see if those calcifications changed. I was diagnosed with stage 2 ductal carinoma on July 28 2014. I cried from the moment I had the biopsy to day of surgery. I was in distress and panic. My husband helped me one night by addressing each fear one by one. I can tell you that happily the things I feared the most did not happen to me. I am now over treatment and healing well. Its easy for me to say, hard for you to do but try to be calm, now that what is already is and that may just be nothing at all.  I wish the best for you.
Posts.Title: Wait for biopsy - A little scared, A lot nervous

Posts.Content: On Jan 04, 2015 4:54 PM janr888 wrote:  she  has a great prognosis this should be enough for both of you .  It is so hard  i know  ,  just focus on the fact that she is gonna make it , she is one of the lucky ones , I have a year of herceptin to get thru but everybody says I'm okay , I don't feel okay , I feel scared and so weary , I am starting radiation next friday , did your wife have that? anyway hang in there , I know you mean well but a good prognosis is not good enough.  Cancer recovering is hard.
Posts.Title: Need Help

Posts.Content: Doug, First I send you a big hug. Second I recommend that you breathe. Its just as hard to be the caregiver as it is to be the patient. I will share with you what my dear husband said to me when I was diagnosed. He said " I am certain that along the way I am going to say or do something really stupid. I am certain that I will not recognize your needs, I am certain that I can not possibly know that it feels like to be you. I ask of you to not shut me out, to tell me plainly what you need and want, to forgive me for my shortcomings and also remember that I need your love and support just as certainly as you need mine." Everything he said is true. One night I was in such a state if despair , fear desperation and he helped me by addressing each fear one by one.  I think its important for you to know that the menopause she is experiencing is not normal , healthy menopause. This is a nuclear, turbo-charged, mutant menopause. Tamoxifin stops the bodies ability to use estrogen. Estrogen is a womens "feel good" hormone. She sadly has  none of the benefits. Ask her MD if he can Rx Effesor, its an antidepressant that will reduce the hot flushes. Also ask if she can take something like Activan, which is a mild calming medication. She needs more than will power, she needs medical help. She is suffering. Your post was heart breaking and I see sincere. You said you became fraustrated and spoke w/o thinking, that you did not mean to hurt her feelings. You said you feel you failed her. Tell her that. exactly like that. The mere fact that you feel that you failed and that you fear you can not change it proves that you are a good, caring man. Go pat yourself on the back and talk to your wife.
Posts.Title: Need Help

Posts.Content: That was a lovely update email. Love does conquer all.  You come across as a good person so dont beat yourself up. And I also hope that she has an awakening and sees that you need her too .
Posts.Title: Need Help

Posts.Content: I have had multiple needle biopsies. Just last July it was positive for cancer but before this I was pictured , poked and pinched many , many times for nothing. Hang in there, its nothing until it is something. However I know its easy to say, difficult to do. My thoughts are with you.
Posts.Title: Freaking Out after mammogram

Posts.Content: I have had multiple needle biopsies. Just last July it was positive for cancer but before this I was pictured , poked and pinched many , many times for nothing. Hang in there, its nothing until it is something. However I know its easy to say, difficult to do. My thoughts are with you.
Posts.Title: Freaking Out after mammogram

Posts.Content: Remember it is nothing until it is confirmed to be something. my best to you.
Posts.Title: Advice needed

Posts.Content: Its impossible to have recurred breast cancer in a prosthetic breast however your breast still has skin, and muscle behind the prosthetic and possible along the perimeter. More likely than not its a cysts of some kind or even a fault in the prosthetic. There is only one way to know, see your MD. Good luck and let us know how it goes.
Posts.Title: Advice needed

Posts.Content: Im so sorry you had that experience but 10 years of remission is wonferful. I hope I didnt confuse the original poster. I meant to say that a tumor in an implant is not possible but it is possible on any tissue/muscle/skin anywhere around the implant. I wish her all the best and you as well
Posts.Title: Advice needed

Posts.Content: Hi sugar, I am sorry you are going through this at such a young age > breast cancer does not discriminate on age. If you have breasts you can get breast cancer (men too).  Sonograms can not diagnose anything, this tests only confirms if there is a lesion of sort and if a mammo is indicated. Only a biopsy can determine if any growth is begnin.  I'm glad you decided to go to the surgeon. Really, do you want something growing in there withou knowing what it is? I (we) wish you the best. Let us know.

Posts.Title: misdiagnosis?!?!?!

Posts.Content: They refused a mastectomy with lubular cancer. I thought that mastectomy was always to be offered.
Posts.Title: Medicare coverage denied for bilateral mastectomy

Posts.Content: I think we are aware already. We need a cure.
Posts.Title: What do you think? Please Help

Posts.Content: Drinking causing cirrohsis of the liver which is a disease all to itself and would not resembly anything that rads would cause. Your MD ought to be able to distinguish between cirrohsis, hepititis A,C, C and liver toxicity from chemicals.  Rads would cause something like scaring.  Good luck to you
Posts.Title: Liver damage after having radiation for breast cancer

Posts.Content: So, glad to hear someone agrees. Awareness never cured anyone however it sells alot of merchandise.
Posts.Title: What do you think? Please Help

Posts.Content: I am horrified to read that you were so burned after 16 rounds. I had 35 rounds with the last 5 with booster. My skin was pink, I had fatigue but burned absolutely not. The machine and all surrounding it was set up specifically for me. There was a body mold made just for me to have me stay always in the same position. I am told I have recieved the maximum allowed. I did not have chemo so surgery , rads and hormone therapy are my treatments. Sometimes I wonder if MD's all the the same medical books. Remember not all graduated top in the class either. Coffee enemas is a bunch of malarkey. Clean foods rich in antioxidants, pleanty of clean water,rest and exercise is the only recognized ways to recover. Good luck and I send you a gentle hug.
Posts.Title: Liver damage after having radiation for breast cancer

Posts.Content: Heartwarming and encouraging to read your post.
Posts.Title: Arimidex..may not be working

Posts.Content: "Working" means that the arimidex is blocking aromasin that is part of the cycle of estrogen production. A hormone level blood test will show the levels of estrogen, testosterone, LSH. The estrogen should be nearly 0 or 95% lower that what is normal. This does not mean that the Arimedex is keeping the cancer away. It means that it is keeping the estrogen down which feeds estrogen positive breast cancers. The hope is always that blocking the estrogen is enough to keep the beast at bay. Don't use side effects as an indicator as most women have few SE. Then again those SE can start up at anytime.
Posts.Title: Arimidex..may not be working

Posts.Content: Im not sure but I think the drans stay so long as the body is draining . Ask your MD , he/she should really keep you informed. Good luck, a gentle hug.
Posts.Title: drains, agggh

Posts.Content: I read over and over again the exercise is the key. But I can not wrap my mind around how to get that into my schedule. I am up early and out of the house early. If I were to exercise in the morning I would have to wake even earlier. I work 8-9 hours a day.I push myself to make it to the end of the work day. How in the world would I ever drag my sorry, exhausted butt to a workout after a workday. I am going to yoga one day a week at our local cancer center. Its hard to do even that. I hear of women that go to meditation, and massage therapy, gyms, accupuncture, and diaticians. It all seems to work but what about us that have a full day just trying to make a living.  Is there any hope for patients like me?
Posts.Title: Arimidex..may not be working
